category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 38 (Preparation and storage of material safety data sheets)
contents: Article 38 (Preparation and storage of material safety data sheets) ① The Chairman of the Board shall provide the following information to workers handling chemicals designated as hazardous and hazardous substances in Chapter 7 of the Industrial Safety Act (hereinafter referred to as *target chemicals). The requirements must be complied with. Revised 2021. 12. 22., 2022. 12. 16., 1. Posting the material safety data sheet for each target chemical in a place where it can be easily viewed or accessed, 2. Materials that allow the material safety data sheet to be easily checked, or Posting on computer equipment, ② The chairman of the board of directors must place a warning label on containers containing target chemicals used within the workplace in accordance with the method prescribed by the Industrial Safety Act. However, this excludes cases where the container already has a warning sign in accordance with the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act. ③ The Chairman shall handle the work of handling chemical substances subject to Article 110 of the Industrial Safety Act (hereinafter referred to as *substances subject to the Material Safety Data Sheet). Management instructions containing the following items must be posted for each process. In this case, management instructions can be prepared and posted by group of substances subject to the material safety data sheet with similar hazards and risks. 1. Product name, 2. Harmfulness to health and environment, physical risks, 3. Safety and health handling. Precautions, 4. Appropriate protective equipment, 5. First aid measures and how to respond in case of an accident, ④ The chairman must provide training to workers in the following cases to ensure the safety and health of workers handling substances subject to the Material Safety Data Sheet. , 1. When workers are assigned to work on manufacturing, using, transporting or storing substances subject to the Material Safety Data Sheet, 2. When new substances subject to the Material Safety Data Sheet are introduced, 3. When hazard/risk information is changed.
